column1: You scared me, sneaking into my room like that!
column2: 你怎麼偷偷溜進我的房間，嚇死我了！

column1: *sigh*... so I've been playing 'Journey of the Prairie King' for hours and I can't even beat the first level...
column2: *唉*……我玩「草原之王的冒險之旅」已經好幾個小時了，卻連第一關都過不去……

column1: This game is ridiculously hard!
column2: 這遊戲難度也太誇張了吧！

column1: Well, either that or I'm just terrible at it.
column2: 呃，要不然就是我技術太差了。

column1: Hey, do you want to try this level together with me? I think I might do better with your help.
column2: 嘿，你要不要和我一起玩玩這一關？有你幫忙應該會簡單些。

column1: Ugh, I give up... I'll never get past the first level.
column2: 呃，我放棄了……看來這輩子是過不了第二關了。

column1: Oh well... thanks for trying.
column2: 好吧……至少努力過了。

column1: Hey, that was fun!
column2: 嘿，挺有意思的！

column1: Well thanks, @. You seem to really know your way around a joystick, huh? I guess that makes sense.
column2: 好的，謝謝。@，你用手把還真是有一套啊。這倒也說得通。

column1: Thanks, @. I didn't think you'd know how to work a joystick so well! But it seems you're experienced.
column2: 非常感謝。@，沒想到你玩搖桿這麼熟練！感覺像是很有經驗的樣子呢！

column1: Hey! I was hoping you'd show up. I wanna show you something.
column2: 嘿！我正想著你什麼時候來呢。我想給你看一樣東西。

column1: See this? It's called a spirit board. Have you ever used one?
column2: 你看到了嗎？這個就是通靈板。你以前用過嗎？

column1: Put your hands on the planchette with me...
column2: 把我們的手一起放到板子上……

column1: Now the spirits will guide us toward a...
column2: 現在，靈魂將把我們領向……

column1: LOOK, it's moving!
column2: 快看！在動欸！

column1: The first letter is... 'I' ...
column2: 第一個字母是……「我」……

column1: Next is... '<' ...
Wow, look at it go! It's spelling out... '%firstnameletter'...
column2: 哇，快看它動的多快！它寫著……'%firstnameletter'……

column1: I < %firstnameletter...?
column2: 我 < %firstnameletter……？

column1: Oops, accidentally knocked over the board! Heh heh...
column2: 哎呀，一不留神把板子打翻了！嘻嘻……

column1: It's just a silly game, it doesn't mean anything.
column2: 這就是個蠢遊戲，沒什麼意義的啦。

column1: I, um, have something to do. You'll have to go... Sorry.
column2: 我，呃，還有事要做。你得走了……對不起了。

column1: Found Pierre's 'secret stash'.
column2: 你找到了皮耶爾的「秘密收藏」。

column1: Hey! Who's in the bedroom?
column2: 嘿！誰在臥室裡？

column1: Wha...? How did you find that?!
column2: 你……你是怎麼發現的？！

column1: Quick, give it to me!
column2: 快給我！

column1: Promise me you won't tell anyone about this.
column2: 發誓你不會把這事告訴任何人。

column1: Your secret is safe with me.
column2: 我會為你保守秘密的。

column1: Your wife deserves to know about this.
column2: 這事應該讓你太太知道。

column1: *grumble*...now I have to find a new hiding spot...*grumble*
column2: *嘟囔*……這下又得找個新的藏匿點了……*嘟囔*

column1: Stop telling me how to live my life!
column2: 不要再對我的生活指手畫腳了！

column1: Hey, cut it out! We're letting you live here free of charge until you finish school. It seems like you don't appreciate that at all!
column2: 喂，別鬧了！我們讓你在讀完書之前住在這裡，一個錢都不花。但看樣子你一點感激的意思都沒有啊！

column1: Stop trying to make me feel guilty.
column2: 不要試圖用那種說法讓我有罪惡感！

column1: I appreciate that you and Dad are helping me out, but expecting me to dress the way you want is ridiculous.
column2: 有你和老爸幫忙，我真的很感激。但讓我只能按照你們希望的方式生活，實在是太不可理喻了。

column1: I'm not a little girl anymore, Mom.
column2: 我已經不是小女孩了，媽。

column1: ...You're right. I'm sorry.
column2: ……你說得對，我很抱歉。

column1: Is someone there?
column2: 有人在嗎？

column1: I swear, this house is haunted.
column2: 我和你說，這屋子絕對在鬧鬼。

column1: Urgghh...
column2: 呃啊啊……

column1: Sorry... I was fighting with my Mom earlier.
column2: 抱歉……我剛才在和我媽吵架。

column1: Alright! That concludes our aerobics class!
column2: 好吧。好，今天的體操課就到此為止！

column1: Are you breaking a sweat?
column2: 你出汗了沒？

column1: *pant*...*pant*...Yes.
column2: *喘息*……*喘息*……出了。

column1: @! You were watching me?
column2: @！你一直在看嗎？

column1: ...How embarrassing... I didn't want anyone to know. Least of all you.
column2: ……真是丟人……本來還想瞞著大家呢。至少也不該讓你知道。

column1: I'm just trying to stay healthy. As you get older, it requires more effort.
column2: 我只是想保持健康的體魄。畢竟年紀大了，就更需要努力了。

column1: I'm not in very good shape, though... I can hardly keep up with them.
column2: 但我身體還是不行……總覺得跟不上他們呢。

column1: Look... Don't tell everyone in town that I'm doing dance aerobics, okay?
column2: 聽著……別告訴鎮上的人我在跳健身操，好嗎？

column1: I won't tell.
column2: 我不會說的。

column1: I can't promise that.
column2: 這我可說不好。

column1: Wow, that was quite a workout...
column2: 哎呦，真是累死人了……

column1: Welcome To Pierre's! How can I help you?
column2: 歡迎光臨皮耶爾商店！有什麼需要的嗎？

column1: Ahem...
column2: 那個……

column1: Come and get it folks... coupons for 50% off your purchase at JojaMart!
column2: 大家快來哦……Joja 超市五折優惠券大放送啦！

column1: 50 Percent!?!?
Well? Any takers?
column2: 嗯？有沒有人要啊？

column1: But... I can't match those prices! I'd be selling at a loss!
column2: 但……這價格我可比不了啊！這簡直是賠本賤賣！

column1: It must be so difficult for you... To lose your loyal customers like that.
column2: 失去了這麼忠實的顧客……一定很難受吧。

column1: But can you blame them? Joja Corporation is clearly the superior choice.
column2: 但怎麼能怪他們呢？顯然，Joja 企業才是正確的選擇。

column1: Soon the whole town will realize that.
column2: 很快，全鎮的人都會意識到這一點。

column1: Sigh...
Gus, I have just the thing for you...
column2: 格斯，我這裡正有你想要的東西……

column1: I'm all ears.
column2: 願聞其詳。

column1: It's a bundle of locally sourced, organic, heirloom veggies...
column2: 是一袋原種的有機蔬菜，本地生產的……

column1: These are hand picked and sorted, to ensure only the very finest in quality and taste.
column2: 經過精挑細選，品質和味道上乘。

column1: This is a once-in-a-lifetime kind of offer!
column2: 過了這個村，就沒這店了！

column1: That sounds pretty good! I could use some quality veggies for the saloon. How much does it cost?
column2: 聽起來不錯嘛！我在酒吧裡用得到優質蔬菜。多少錢？

column1: ONLY... *mumble* mumble*
column2: 只！要！……（咕噥咕噥）

column1: What was that?
column2: 什麼東西？

column1: Hahaha... for a moment there, I thought I heard, '25,000g'.
column2: 哈哈哈……我還以為我聽到了「25,000G」。

column1: Heh... that's right. It really is a bargain, isn't it?
column2: 呃……就是這個價。確實很便宜吧？

column1: Pierre, are you crazy? There's no way I could afford that. I'd have to sell the saloon!
column2: 皮耶爾，你瘋了嗎？我根本買不起，除非我把酒吧賣了！

column1: I overheard the price... that's outrageous! You should be ashamed.
column2: 我不小心聽到價格……太離譜了！你應該感到慚愧。

column1: Wait! How about 10,000g then!?
No way!
column2: 不可能！

column1: It's a disaster, @...
column2: 太糟糕了，@……

column1: I thought this was a surefire business strategy.
column2: 我以為這個做生意的策略特別可靠。

column1: But it turns out, no one is willing to buy vegetables at a 10x price markup, even if I put the little 'organic' sticker on them.
column2: 結果發現，即使我貼了「有機」的標籤，還是沒有人願意以 10 倍的差價買蔬菜。

column1: You win some, you lose some
column2: 有得必有失

column1: You should be less greedy
column2: 別那麼貪心

column1: I'm offended they didn't want my veggies
column2: 他們不買我的蔬菜，氣死我了

column1: You're right, you can't run a business without taking some risk.
column2: 你說得對，做生意總會有風險。

column1: Hey, I'm not forcing anyone to buy it! If they don't like the price, they can move on.
column2: 喂，我也沒有逼人買啊！如果他們不接受這個價格，大可直接離開。

column1: ...But, I guess you have a point. If I make all my customers angry, then pretty soon I won't have any customers at all...
column2: ……不過你說得也有道理。如果我惹惱了所有顧客，那很快就沒有人來買東西了……

column1: Your veggies look great, @. It's Pierre's price that turned us away.
column2: @，你的蔬菜賣相很好。是皮耶爾出的價格把我們趕跑了。

column1: By the way, @... you look like you could really use a veggie dinner tonight.
column2: @，說起來……說不定你今天可以用這個蔬菜做一頓晚餐。

column1: What do you say, wanna buy these back for the low, low price of 2,501g?
column2: 你覺得呢，想要以 2,501G 的超低價買回去嗎？
